issue.title: curl 8.14 suddenly reporting OOM in stresstest

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A Modern and Flexible Web Client for R

issue.body:
After upgrading to curl 8.14, our stresstest that downloads 1000 files bails immediately with "Out of memory". I don't think it has even started downloading anything.

Need to investigate. Reprex in r:

```r
mirror <- 'https://cloud.r-project.org'
pkgs <- row.names(available.packages(repos = mirror))[1:1000]
urls <- sprintf('%s/web/packages/%s/DESCRIPTION', mirror, pkgs)
out <- rep('/dev/null', length(urls))
results <- curl::multi_download(urls, out, progress = TRUE)
```

FYI @bagder @jay

rename.from: curl 8.14 reporting OOM when using more than 400 handles
rename.to: curl_multi_add_handle() returning OOM when using more than 400 handles

body: Reproduces for me on Linux as well

issue.title: multi: fix add_handle resizing

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Due to someone being stupid, the resizing of the multi's transfer table was actually shrinking it. Oh my.

Add test751 to reproduce, add code assertion.

refs #17473

body: Oh, that was a stupid mistake of mine. Fix in #17475.

body: Could we ping distro maintainers to ship this patch with curl 8.14.0? I think it's quite a bad bug.
Thanks, confirm that with this patch everything works for me again ðŸ’¯
